alert.note: Alert for Dundy; Hitchcock; Red Willow (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued December 24 at 6:26PM CST until December 27 at 6:00AM CST by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM MONDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH LATE TUESDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...Blizzard conditions possible. Total snow accumulations ranging anywhere from 2 to 6 inches. Northwest winds may gust up to 55 mph. * WHERE...Portions of eastern Colorado, northwest Kansas and southwest Nebraska, mainly along and north of Interstate 70. * WHEN...Monday afternoon through Tuesday night. * IMPACTS...A prolonged period of dangerous travel conditions associated with accumulating snow, strong northwesterly winds and blowing snow. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow will overspread the watch area from the east Christmas afternoon and evening as a deepening low pressure system in Iowa shifts westward into eastern Nebraska. Periods of snow are possible throughout the day on Tuesday and into Tuesday night, as the aforementioned low pressure system meanders southward into eastern Kansas. Areas located along and north of Highway 36 in Kansas and Nebraska are more prone to experience significant snow accumulation and blizzard conditions. The near-stationary nature of this system will result in a prolonged period of breezy to strong northwest winds over most, or all, of the Tri-State area on Christmas Day and Tuesday.
info.instruction: Blizzard conditions are possible across the watch area late Christmas day into Tuesday. Strongly consider alternate travel plans. If you absolutely must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
